ArabicTitle: مِنْ سِفْرِ أَيُّوبَ الْصِدِّيق بَرَكَتُهُ الْمُقَدَّسَةُ فَلْتَكُنْ مَعَنَا. آمين. ( ۱۲ ، ۱۳ ، ١٤ )

Hymn.Arabic: فَأَجَابَ أَيُّوبُ وَقَالَ:
Hymn.English: 12:1 Then Job answered and said:

Hymn.Arabic: أَلَا إِنَّكُمْ رِجَالٌ فِي الْحَقِيقَةِ وَفِي مَوْتِكُمْ تَمُوتُ الْحِكْمَةُ!
Hymn.English: 2 No doubt you are the people, And wisdom will die with you!

Hymn.Arabic: غَيْرَ أَنَّ لِي عَقْلَا كَمَا لَكُمْ. لَا أَقَصِّرُ عَنْكُمْ فِي شَيْءٍ، وَمَنِ الَّذِي يَفُوتُهُ مِثْلُ هَذِهِ ؟
Hymn.English: 3 But I have understanding as well as you; I am not inferior to you. Indeed, who does not know such things as these?

Hymn.Arabic: أَفَأَصْبَحْتُ هُزُؤا لِأَخِلَّائِي، وَأَنَا أَدْعُو اللَّهَ فَيَسْتَجِيبُنِي ؟ أَهْزُءًا يَكُونُ الصِّدِّيقُ السَّلِيمُ ؟
Hymn.English: 4 I am one mocked by his friends, Who called on God, and He answered him, The just and blameless who is ridiculed.

Hymn.Arabic: حَقُّ الْبَائِسِ فِي رَأْي السَّعِيدِ إِهَانَةٌ ، فَهِيَ مُعَدَّةٌ لِمَنْ زَلَّتْ قَدَمُهُ.
Hymn.English: 5 A lamp is despised in the thought of one who is at ease; It is made ready for those whose feet slip.

Hymn.Arabic: أَخْبِيَةُ اللُّصوص فِي سَلَامٍ ، وَالطُّمَانِينَةُ لِمُسْخِطِي اللَّهِ ، لِكُلِّ مَنْ أَغْنَى اللَّهُ يَدَهُ.
Hymn.English: 6 The tents of robbers prosper, And those who provoke God are secure--In what God provides by His hand.

Hymn.Arabic: وَلَكِنِ اسْألِ الْبَهَائِمَ فَتُعَلِمَكَ ، وَطُيُورَ السَّمَاءِ فَتُخْبِرَكَ
Hymn.English: 7 But now ask the beasts, and they will teach you; And the birds of the air, and they will tell you;

Hymn.Arabic: اسْتَفْهِمِ الْأَرْضَ فَتُلَقِنَكَ ، وَأَسْمَاكُ الْبَحْرِ تُحَدِّثُكَ.
Hymn.English: 8 Or speak to the earth, and it will teach you; And the fish of the sea will explain to you.

Hymn.Arabic: فَأَيِّ لَا يَعْلَمُ أَنَّ ذَلِكَ إِنَّمَا صَنَعَتْهُ يَدُ الرَّبِّ.
Hymn.English: 9 Who among all these does not know That the hand of the Lord has done this,

Hymn.Arabic: الَّذِي فِي يَدِهِ نَفْسُ كُلَّ حَيّ وَأَرْوَاحُ الْبَشَرِ أَجْمَعِينَ.
Hymn.English: 10 In whose hand is the life of every living thing, And the breath of all mankind?

Hymn.Arabic: أَلَيْسَتِ الْأُذُنُ تَخْتَبِرُ الْأَقْوَالَ ، كَمَا يَذُوقُ الْحَنَكُ الطَّعَامَ ؟
Hymn.English: 11 Does not the ear test words And the mouth taste its food?

Hymn.Arabic: وَإِنَّمَا الْحِكْمَةُ عِنْدَ الْأَشْيَبِ ، وَالْفِطْنَةُ فِي طول الأيام.
Hymn.English: 12 Wisdom is with aged men, And with length of days, understanding.

Hymn.Arabic: اللَّهُ عِنْدَهُ الحِكْمَةُ وَالْجَبَرُوتُ. وَلَهُ الْمَشُورَةُ وَالْفِطْنَةُ.
Hymn.English: 13 With Him are wisdom and strength, He has counsel and understanding.

Hymn.Arabic: مَا هَدَمَهُ لَا يُبْنَى , وَمَنْ أَغْلَقَ عَلَيْهِ لَا يُفْتَحُ لَهُ.
Hymn.English: 14 If He breaks a thing down, it cannot be rebuilt; If He imprisons a man, there can be no release.

Hymn.Arabic: يَحْبِسُ الْمِيَاهَ فَتَجِفُّ. أَوْ يُطْلِقُهَا فَتُخَرِّبُ الْأَرْضَ
Hymn.English: 15 If He withholds the waters, they dry up; If He sends them out, they overwhelm the earth.

Hymn.Arabic: عِنْدَهُ الْعِزَّةُ وَالْحَوْلُ (الاستطاعة)، وَلَهُ الضَّالُ وَمَنْ يُضِلُّهُ.
Hymn.English: 16 With Him are strength and prudence. The deceived and the deceiver are His.

Hymn.Arabic: يُرْسِلُ الْمُشِيرِينَ أَسْرَى ، وَيُسَفَهُ الْقُضَاةَ،
Hymn.English: 17 He leads counselors away plundered, And makes fools of the judges.

Hymn.Arabic: يَحُلُ مَنَاطِقَ الْمُلُوكِ . وَيَجْعَلُ الْقُيُودَ مَنَاطِقَ عَلَى أَحْقَائِهِمْ
Hymn.English: 18 He loosens the bonds of kings, And binds their waist with a belt.

Hymn.Arabic: يُرْسِلُ الْكَهَنَةَ أَسْرَى وَيُنَكِّسُ الرَّاسِخِينَ.
Hymn.English: 19 He leads princes away plundered, And overthrows the mighty.

Hymn.Arabic: يَقْطَعُ أَلْسِنَةَ الثَّقَاتِ ، وَيَسْلُبُ ذَوْقَ الشَّيُوخِ.
Hymn.English: 20 He deprives the trusted ones of speech, And takes away the discernment of the elders.

Hymn.Arabic: يَصَبُّ الْهَوَانَ عَلَى الْكُرَمَاءِ. وَيُرْخِي مَنَاطِقَ الْأَقْوِيَاءِ.
Hymn.English: 21 He pours contempt on princes, And disarms the mighty.

Hymn.Arabic: يُجَلِي مِنَ الظُّلْمَةِ أَعْمَاقَهَا. وَيُبْرِزُ ظِلَالُ الْمَوْتِ إِلَى النُّورِ.
Hymn.English: 22 He uncovers deep things out of darkness, And brings the shadow of death to light.

Hymn.Arabic: يُنْمِي الْأُمَمَ ثُمَّ يَمْحَقُهَا، وَيَفْسَحُ لِلشُّعُوبِ ثُمَّ يَحْصُرُهُمْ
Hymn.English: 23 He makes nations great, and destroys them; He enlarges nations, and guides them.

Hymn.Arabic: يَذْهَبُ بِأَلْبَابِ الَّذِينَ يَسُودُونَ شَعْبَ الْأَرْضِ. وَيَهِيمُهُمْ فِي تِيْهِ لَا طَرِيقَ فِيهِ.
Hymn.English: 24 He takes away the understanding of the chiefs of the people of the earth, And makes them wander in a pathless wilderness.

Hymn.Arabic: فَيَتَلَمَّسُونَ فِي الظُّلْمَةِ وَلَيْسَ نُورٌ ، وَيَهِيمُهُمْ هَيَامُ السَّكْرَانِ .
Hymn.English: 25 They grope in the dark without light, And He makes them stagger like a drunken man.

Hymn.Arabic: ذَلِكَ كُلُّهُ قَدْ رَأَتُهُ عَيْنِي. وَسَمِعَتْهُ أُذُنِي وَفَطِنْتُ لَهُ.
Hymn.English: 13:1 Behold, my eye has seen all this, My ear has heard and understood it.

Hymn.Arabic: وَمَا تَعْلَمُونَ فَإِنِّي أَنَا أَيْضًا أَعْلَمُهُ. لَا أُقْصِرُ عَنْكُمْ فِي شَيْءٍ
Hymn.English: 2 What you know, I also know; I am not inferior to you.

Hymn.Arabic: لَكِنِّي إِنَّمَا أَخَاطِبُ الْقَدِيرَ ، وَأَوَدُّ أَنْ أَحَاجَ اللَّهَ
Hymn.English: 3 But I would speak to the Almighty, And I desire to reason with God.

Hymn.Arabic: أَمَّا أَنْتُمْ فَإِنَّمَا تُضَمّدُونَ بِالْكَذِبِ وَطِبُّكُمْ بَاطِلٌ
Hymn.English: 4 But you forgers of lies, You are all worthless physicians.

Hymn.Arabic: مَنْ لِي بِأَنْ تَسْكُتُوا , فَيَكُونَ لَكُمْ فِي ذَلِكَ حِكْمَةٌ
Hymn.English: 5 Oh, that you would be silent, And it would be your wisdom!

Hymn.Arabic: اِسْمَعُوا حُجَجِي، وَأَصْغُوا إِلَى دَعاوي شَفَتَيَّ
Hymn.English: 6 Now hear my reasoning, And heed the pleadings of my lips.

Hymn.Arabic: ألْأَجْلِ اللَّهِ تَتَكَلَّمُونَ ظُلْمًا ، أَمْ لأَجْلِهِ تَنْطِقُونَ بِالْبُهْتَانِ ؟
Hymn.English: 7 Will you speak wickedly for God, And talk deceitfully for Him?

Hymn.Arabic: أَلَعَلَّكُمْ تُجَاوِبُونَهُ , أَمْ عَنِ اللَّهِ تَخَاصِمُونَ ؟
Hymn.English: 8 Will you show partiality for Him? Will you contend for God?

Hymn.Arabic: أَيُحْمَدُ ذَلِكَ يَوْمَ يَفْحَصُكُمْ ، أَمْ أَنْتُمْ تَخْدَعُونَهُ كَمَا يُخْدَعُ إِنْسَانٌ ؟
Hymn.English: 9 Will it be well when He searches you out? Or can you mock Him as one mocks a man?

Hymn.Arabic: بَلْ لِيُوَبِخَنَّكُمْ عَلَى مُحَابَاتِكُمُ الْخَفِيَّةِ.
Hymn.English: 10 He will surely rebuke you If you secretly show partiality.

Hymn.Arabic: وَلْيُرْعِبَنَّكُمْ جَلَالُهُ ، وَيَقَعُ عَلَيْكُمْ ذُعْرُهُ
Hymn.English: 11 Will not His excellence make you afraid, And the dread of Him fall upon you?

Hymn.Arabic: إِنَّ مَا تَذْكُرُونَهُ أَمْثَالٌ مِنْ رَمَادٍ ، وَحُصُونَكُمْ حُصُونٌ مِنْ طِينٍ.
Hymn.English: 12 Your platitudes are proverbs of ashes, Your defenses are defenses of clay.

Hymn.Arabic: أَسْكُتُوا عَنِّي فَأَتَكَلَّمَ مَهْمَا أَصَابَنِي ,
Hymn.English: 13 Hold your peace with me, and let me speak, Then let come on me what may!

Hymn.Arabic: لِمَاذَا آَخُذُ لَحْمِي بِأَسْنَانِي ، وَأَجْعَلُ نَفْسِي فِي كَفّي ؟
Hymn.English: 14 Why do I take my flesh in my teeth, And put my life in my hands?

Hymn.Arabic: إِنَّهُ وَلَوْ قَتَلَنِي أَبْقَى آمِلًا لَهُ , غَيْرَ أَنِّي أَحْتَجُ عَنْ طَرْقِي أَمَامَهُ.
Hymn.English: 15 Though He slay me, yet will I trust Him. Even so, I will defend my own ways before Him.

Hymn.Arabic: وَهُوَ يَكُونُ خَلَاصِي , أَمَّا المُخَالِفُ فَلَا يَقُومُ أَمَامَهُ.
Hymn.English: 16 He also shall be my salvation, For a hypocrite could not come before Him.

Hymn.Arabic: فَاسْمَعُوا كَلَامِي وَمَا أُبَيِّنُهُ عَلَى مَسَامِعِكُمْ.
Hymn.English: 17 Listen carefully to my speech, And to my declaration with your ears.

Hymn.Arabic: فَإِنِّي قَدْ تَدَبَّرْتُ الدَّعْوَى وَأَنَا عَالِمٌ بِأَنِّي سَأَكُونَ بَارًا،
Hymn.English: 18 See now, I have prepared my case, I know that I shall be vindicated.

Hymn.Arabic: مَنِ الَّذِي يُحَاجِجُنِي؟ فَإِنِّي لَا أَلْبَثُ أَنْ أَسْكُتَ وَتَفِيضَ رُوحِي.
Hymn.English: 19 Who is he who will contend with me? If now I hold my tongue, I perish.

Hymn.Arabic: أَمْرَيْنِ لَا تَفْعَلْ بِي ، فَحِينَئِذٍ لَا أَتَوَارَى عَنْ وَجْهِكَ.
Hymn.English: 20 Only two things do not do to me, Then I will not hide myself from You:

Hymn.Arabic: أَزِلْ عَنِّي يَدَكَ ، وَلَا تُرَوِّعْنِي هَيْبَتُكَ,
Hymn.English: 21 Withdraw Your hand far from me, And let not the dread of You make me afraid.

Hymn.Arabic: ادْعُ فَأَجِيبَ ، أَوْ فَلْأُخَاطِبُكَ أَنَا فَتُجَاوِبَنِي.
Hymn.English: 22 Then call, and I will answer; Or let me speak, then You respond to me.

Hymn.Arabic: مَا الَّذِي لِي مِنَ الْآثَامِ وَالْخَطَايَا؟
Hymn.English: 23 How many are my iniquities and sins? Make me know my transgression and my sin.

Hymn.Arabic: أَعْلِمُنِي مَعْصِيَتِي وَخَطِيئَتِي.
Hymn.English: 24 Why do You hide Your face, And regard me as Your enemy?

Hymn.Arabic: لِمَاذَا تُوَارِي وَجْهَكَ ، وَتَعُدُّنِي عَدُوًّا لَكَ ؟
Hymn.English: 25 Will You frighten a leaf driven to and fro? And will You pursue dry stubble?

Hymn.Arabic: إِنَّمَا تُرَوَعُ وَرَقَةً مَنْثُورَةً ، وَتُرْهِقُ عُصَافَةً يَابِسَةَ .
Hymn.English: 26 For You write bitter things against me, And make me inherit the iniquities of my youth.

Hymn.Arabic: فَإِنَّكَ تَكْتُبُ عَلَيَّ مُعَامَلَاتٍ عَنِيفَةً ، وَتُلْحِقُ بي آثَامَ صِبَايَ.
Hymn.English: 27 You put my feet in the stocks, And watch closely all my paths. You set a limit for the soles of my feet.

Hymn.Arabic: وَتَجْعَلُ رِجْلَيَّ فِي مِقْطَرَةِ ، وَتُرَاقِبُ جَمِيعَ مَسَالِكِي ، وَتَخُطُّ حَوْلَ بَاطِنِ قَدَمَيَّ.
Hymn.English: 28 Man decays like a rotten thing, Like a garment that is moth-eaten.

Hymn.Arabic: وَهَذَا الرَّجُلُ قَدْ نُخِرَ كَرُفَاتٍ مُتَسَوّسَةٍ ، وَكَثَوْبٍ قَدْ أَكَلَهُ الْعُثْ.
Hymn.English: 14:1 Man who is born of woman Is of few days and full of trouble.

Hymn.Arabic: الْإِنْسَانُ مَوْلُودُ الْمَرْأَةِ ، قَلِيلُ الْأَيَّامِ كَثِيرُ السَّقَاءِ
Hymn.English: 2 He comes forth like a flower and fades away; He flees like a shadow and does not continue.

Hymn.Arabic: كَزَهْرٍ يَنْبُتُ ثُمَّ يُقْطَعْ , كَظِلَّ يَبْرَحُ وَلَا يَقِفُ.
Hymn.English: 3 And do You open Your eyes on such a one, And bring me to judgment with Yourself?

Hymn.Arabic: إِنَّكَ عَلَى مِثْلِ هَذَا فَتَحْتَ عَيْنَيْكَ ، وَإِيَّايَ نَافَذْتَ لِلتَّحَاكُمِ مَعَكَ.
Hymn.English: 4 Who can bring a clean thing out of an unclean? No one!

Hymn.Arabic: مَنْ يَأْتِي بِطَاهِرٍ مِنْ نَجس ؟ لَا أَحَدَ
Hymn.English: 5 Since his days are determined, The number of his months is with You; You have appointed his limits, so that he cannot pass.

Hymn.Arabic: فَإِذَا كَانَتْ أَيَّامُهُ مَحْدُودَةً ، وَعَدَدُ شُهُورِهِ مُعَيَّناً عِنْدَكَ ، وَقَدْ قَضَيْتَ لَهُ أَجَلًا لَا يَتَعَدَّاهُ.
Hymn.English: 6 Look away from him that he may rest, Till like a hired man he finishes his day.

Hymn.Arabic: فَاصْرِفْ طَرْفَكَ عَنْهُ لِيَسْتَرِيحَ ، إِلَى أَنْ يَفِيَ نَهَارَهُ كَالْأَجِيرِ.
Hymn.English: 7 For there is hope for a tree, If it is cut down, that it will sprout again, And that its tender shoots will not cease.

Hymn.Arabic: الشَّجَرَةُ لَهَا رَجَاءُ فَإِنَّهَا إِذَا قُطِعَتْ تُخْلِفُ أَيْضًا وَفِرَاخُهَا لَا تَزُولُ.
Hymn.English: 8 Though its root may grow old in the earth, And its stump may die in the ground,

Hymn.Arabic: وَإِذَا تَعَتَّقَ فِي الْأَرْضِ أَصْلُهَا ، وَمَاتَ فِي التُّرَابِ جَذْرُهَا .
Hymn.English: 9 Yet at the scent of water it will bud And bring forth branches like a plant.

Hymn.Arabic: فَمِنِ اسْتِرْوَاحِ الْمَاءِ تُفَرِّحُ وَتُنْبِتُ فُرُوعًا كَالْغَرِيسَةِ.
Hymn.English: 10 But man dies and is laid away; Indeed he breathes his last And where is he?

Hymn.Arabic: أَمَّا الرَّجُلُ فَإِذَا مَاتَ لَبِثَ هُنَاكَ ، وَالْبَشَرُ مَتَى فَاضَتْ رُوحُهُ ، فَأَيْنَ يُوجَدُ ؟
Hymn.English: 11 As water disappears from the sea, And a river becomes parched and dries up,

Hymn.Arabic: الْبَحْرُ تَنْفَدُ مِيَاهُهُ ، وَالنَّهْرُ يَنْضُبُ وَيَجِفُ .
Hymn.English: 12 So man lies down and does not rise. Till the heavens are no more, They will not awake Nor be roused from their sleep.

Hymn.Arabic: وَالْإِنْسَانُ يَضْطَجِعُ وَلَا يَقُومُ , إِلَى أَنْ تَزُولَ السَّمَاوَاتُ لَا يَسْتَيْقِظُونَ وَلَا يَنْبَعِثُونَ مِنْ مَنَامِهِمْ.
Hymn.English: 13 Oh, that You would hide me in the grave, That You would conceal me until Your wrath is past, That You would appoint me a set time, and remember me!

Hymn.Arabic: لَيْتَكَ تُودِعُنِي وَتُوَارِينِي فِي الْهَاوِيَةِ ، حَتَّى يَجْتَازَ غَضَبُكَ ، وَأَنْ تَضْرِبَ لِي أَجَلًا ثُمَّ تَتَذَكَّرَنِي
Hymn.English: 14 If a man dies, shall he live again? All the days of my hard service I will wait, Till my change comes.

Hymn.Arabic: إِذَا مَاتَ الرَّجُلُ أَفَيَحْيَا ؟ إِذًا لَانْتَظَرْتُ كُلَّ أَيَّامٍ تَجَنُّدِي حَتَّى يَحِينَ ابْتِدَالي.
Hymn.English: 15 You shall call, and I will answer You; You shall desire the work of Your hands.

Hymn.Arabic: فَإِنَّكَ تَدْعُونِي فَأُجِيبُكَ. وَتَنْعَطِفُ إِلَى صُنْعِ يَدَيْكَ.
Hymn.English: 16 For now You number my steps, But do not watch over my sin.

Hymn.Arabic: أَمَّا الْآنَ فَإِنَّكَ تُحْصِي خَطَوَاتِي ، وَتَرْصُدُ خَطَايَايَ
Hymn.English: 17 My transgression is sealed up in a bag, And You cover my iniquity.

Hymn.Arabic: تَخْتِمُ عَلَى مَعْصِيَتِي ، وَتَسْتُرُ عَلَى إِثْمِي.
Hymn.English: 18 But as a mountain falls and crumbles away, And as a rock is moved from its place;

Hymn.Arabic: الْجَبَلُ يَخْسِفُ وَيَنْمَحِقُ ، وَالصَّخَرُ يَتَزَحْزَحُ عَنْ مَكَانِهِ.
Hymn.English: 19 As water wears away stones, And as torrents wash away the soil of the earth; So You destroy the hope of man.

Hymn.Arabic: وَالْحِجَارَةُ تَبْرِيهَا الْمِيَاهُ وَتَجْرُفُ سُيُولُهَا تُرَابَ الْأَرْضِ ، وَأَنْتَ تُفْنِي رَجَاءَ لْإِنْسَانِ.
Hymn.English: 20 You prevail forever against him, and he passes on; You change his countenance and send him away.

Hymn.Arabic: تُرْهِقُهُ عَلَى الدَّوَامِ فَيَنْقَضِي. تُشَوَّهُ وَجْهَهُ ثُمَّ تَطْرُدُهُ.
Hymn.English: 21 His sons come to honor, and he does not know it; They are brought low, and he does not perceive it.

Hymn.Arabic: أَيُكْرَمُ بَنُوهُ ؟ لَا يَعْلَمُ . أَمْ يُهَانُونَ؟ لَا يَدْرِي
Hymn.English: 22 But his flesh will be in pain over it, And his soul will mourn over it.     Glory be to the Holy Trinity. Amen
